meanings.sent1: She kept overornamenting the Christmas tree with shiny baubles.
meanings.sent2: The bride didn't want to overornament her dress with too many sparkles.
meanings.sent3: The chef couldn't resist overornamenting the cake with colorful frosting flowers.
meanings.sent4: The garden looked like a fairy tale with flowers overornamenting every corner.
meanings.sent5: The room felt suffocating with the walls overornamented with intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: The act of adding too many decorations or embellishments.
meanings.sent1: Overornamenting can make a room feel cluttered and overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: She was criticized for the overornamenting of her outfit at the party.
meanings.sent3: The overornamenting of the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The overornamenting of the building facade attracted tourists from afar.
meanings.sent5: The overornamenting of the garden created a magical atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The overornamenting of the palace reflected the king's opulence.
meanings.sent2: The designer preferred simplicity over overornamenting in her creations.
meanings.sent3: The overornamenting of the car interior made it feel like a luxurious lounge.
meanings.sent4: The overornamenting of the necklace made it too heavy to wear comfortably.
meanings.sent5: The overornamenting of the room gave it a regal and grand appearance.
